page.title: 10SHEEP FARMING: BOWERCHALKE
page.content: SHEEP are kept on 3 farms over 693 acres of the stipulated area. Steep downs and grassland provide all year round grazing. BREEDS range from Scotch halfbred Suffolk/Charolais 270 ewes on one farm, to 'Mules' - Blue-faced Leicester (sometimes with Swaledale cross) and Suffolk rams, in two flocks of 1250 & 1500 ewes. Their lambs are bred chiefly for meat. Lambing takes place mostly in the open in April. At about l6 weeks, the lambs go to the famous sheep market at Wilton by road. One smallholder rears sheep for their fleece on 4 acres of grassland. BREEDS - 4 crossbred rams, 2 Jacob rams, & 24 Manx Loughton ewes. The wool she spins, knits and dyes if desired (using natural means). Fine shawls, waist coats and thick sweaters are specialities.
